sen.j: 法界寺 (ほうかいじ)は、京都市伏見区日野にある真言宗醍醐派別格本山。
sen.e: Hokai-ji Temple, located in Hino, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, is a special head temple of the Daigo branch of the Shingon Sect.
Hokai-ji Temple, located in Hino, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, is a special head temple of the Daigo branch of the Shingon Sect.
Hokai-ji Temple, located in Hino, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, is a special head temple of the Daigo branch of the Shingon Sect.

sen.j: 山号を東光山と称する。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Tokozan'.
Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Tokozan.'
Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Tokozan.'

sen.j: 本尊は薬師如来（秘仏）、開基は伝教大師最澄とされている。
sen.e: The temple was founded by Denkyo Daishi Saicho and is dedicated to the principal image statue of Bhechadjaguru (withheld from public view).
The temple was founded by Denkyo Daishi Saicho and is dedicated to the principal image statue of Bhechadjaguru (withheld from public view).
The temple was founded by Dengyo Daishi Saicho and is dedicated to the principal image statue of Bhechadjaguru (withheld from public view).

sen.j: 藤原氏の一族である日野家の氏寺で、「日野薬師」あるいは「乳薬師」の別名で知られる薬師信仰の寺であるとともに、国宝の阿弥陀堂と阿弥陀如来像を有することでも知られる。
sen.e: It is known as being the Bhaisajyaguru-dedicated family temple of the Hino family of the FUJIWARA clan under the alternate names 'Hino Yakushi' and 'Chichi Yakushi' as well as renowned for its National Treasures of the an Amitabha hall and statue of Amitabha.
sen.cmt: ・National Treasures: 新和英大辞典・Amitabha hall: 新和英大辞典
sen.e: It is known as being the Bhaisajyaguru-dedicated family temple of the Hino family of the Fujiwara clan under the alternate names 'Hino Yakushi' and 'Chichi Yakushi' as well as renowned for its National Treasures of the Amitabha hall and statue of Amitabha.

It is known as being the Bhaisajyaguru-dedicated family temple of the Hino family of the Fujiwara clan under the alternate names 'Hino Yakushi' and 'Chichi Yakushi' as well as renowned for its National Treasures of the Amitabha hall and statue of Amitabha.

sen.j: 法界寺は、醍醐寺の南方、宇治市との境界に近い、京都市伏見区日野に所在する。
sen.e: Hokai-ji Temple is situated in Hino, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, to the south of Daigo-ji Temple and near to the Uji City boundary.
Hokai-ji Temple is situated in Hino, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, to the south of Daigo-ji Temple and near to the Uji City boundary.
Hokai-ji Temple is situated in Hino, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, to the south of Daigo-ji Temple and near to the Uji City boundary.

sen.j: 日野は、『方丈記』の著者である鴨長明の住んだ地であり、親鸞の生誕地としても知られる。
sen.e: "Hojoki" author, KAMO no Chomei lived in Hino and it is also the birthplace of Shinran.
"Hojoki" author, KAMO no Chomei lived in Hino and it is also the birthplace of Shinran.
"Hojoki" author, KAMO no Chomei lived in Hino and it is also the birthplace of Shinran.

sen.j: かつて山城国宇治郡日野と呼ばれたこの地は、日野家の領地であった。
sen.e: The Hino area was formerly part of Uji County, Yamashiro Province and was the territory of the Hino family.
The Hino area was formerly part of Uji County, Yamashiro Province and was the territory of the Hino family.
The Hino area was formerly part of Uji County, Yamashiro Province and was the territory of the Hino family.

sen.j: 日野家は藤原北家の一族で、儒学や歌道をよくした家柄である。
sen.e: The Hino family was a family of the Fujiwara Kita clan and had a rich tradition of Confucianism and poetry.
The Hino family was a family of the Fujiwara Kita clan and had a rich tradition of Confucianism and poetry.
The Hino family was a family of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan and had a rich tradition of Confucianism and poetry.
sen.cmt: "the Fujiwara Kita clan"→"the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan"に変更しました。

sen.j: 平安時代後期の永承6年（1051年）、もと文章博士（もんじょうはかせ）で後に出家した日野資業（すけなり）が、薬師如来を安置する堂を建てたのが法界寺の始まりとされている。
sen.e: The origin of Hokai-ji Temple is believed to lie in the Buddha hall enshrining Bhaisajyaguru that was built during the latter part of the Heian Period in 1051 by the monjo hakase Sukenari HINO after entering the priesthood.

The origin of Hokai-ji Temple is believed to lie in the Buddha hall enshrining Bhaisajyaguru that was built during the latter part of the Heian Period in 1051 by the monjo hakase Sukenari HINO after entering the priesthood.

The origin of Hokai-ji Temple is believed to lie in the Buddha hall enshrining Bhaisajyaguru that was built during the latter part of the Heian Period in 1051 by the former doctors of letters (monjo hakase) Sukenari HINO after entering the priesthood.

sen.j: 薬師如来像の胎内には、日野家に代々伝わる、伝教大師最澄自作の三寸の薬師像を納入したという。
sen.e: The inside of the Amitabha statue contains approximately 10cm long statues of Bhaisajyaguru that were created by Denkyo Daishi Saicho and handed down through the Hino family.
The inside of the Amitabha statue contains approximately 10cm long statues of Bhaisajyaguru that were created by Denkyo Daishi Saicho and handed down through the Hino family.
The inside of the Amitabha statue contains approximately 10cm long statues of Bhaisajyaguru that were created by Dengyo Daishi Saicho and handed down through the Hino family.

sen.j: 寺の草創時期については別の伝えもある。
sen.e: There is also an alternative legend regarding the temple's founding.
There is also an alternative legend regarding the temple's founding.
There is also an alternative legend regarding the temple's founding.

sen.j: すなわち、日野資業の4代前の藤原家宗が弘仁13年（822年）、最澄自作の薬師像を本尊とし、最澄を開基として一族の氏寺を建てたとするものである。
sen.e: It tells that the temple was constructed by FUJIWARA no Iemune, who came four generations before Sukenari HINO, as a family temple dedicated to a statue of Bhaisajyaguru carved by Saicho and with Saicho acting as founding patron.

It tells that the temple was constructed in 822 by FUJIWARA no Iemune, who came four generations before Sukenari HINO, as a family temple dedicated to a statue of Bhaisajyaguru carved by Saicho and with Saicho acting as founding patron.

It tells that the temple was constructed in 822 by FUJIWARA no Iemune, who came four generations before Sukenari HINO, as a family temple dedicated to a statue of Bhaisajyaguru carved by Saicho and with Saicho acting as founding patron.

sen.j: その後、平安後期の阿弥陀信仰の高まりや末法思想の普及にともない、法界寺にも阿弥陀堂が建てられた。
sen.e: The later increase in devotion to Amitabha and the spread of the Third Age of Buddhism theory during the latter part of the Heian period led to the construction of an Amitabha hall at Hokai-ji Temple.

The later increase in devotion to Amitabha and the spread of pessimism due to decadent-age theory during the latter part of the Heian period led to the construction of an Amitabha hall at Hokai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 末法思想→pessimism due to decadent-age theory
sen.e: The later increase in devotion to Amitabha and the spread of pessimism due to decadent-age theory during the latter part of the Heian period led to the construction of an Amitabha hall at Hokai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 平安時代後期の法界寺には、当時の日記等の記録で判明するだけで少なくとも5体の丈六の阿弥陀如来像が存在したことがわかっている。
sen.e: It is known from diaries and records of the time that at least five sixteen-shaku (shaku = about 30.3cm) Amitabha statues existed at Hokai-ji Temple during the latter part of the Heian period.
It is known from diaries and records of the time that at least five sixteen-shaku (shaku = about 30.3cm) Amitabha statues existed at Hokai-ji Temple during the latter part of the Heian period.
It is known from diaries and records of the time that at least five sixteen-shaku (shaku = about 30.3cm) Amitabha statues existed at Hokai-ji Temple during the latter part of the Heian period.

sen.j: 現在、阿弥陀堂に安置される像がそのうちのどれに当たるかは判明していない。
sen.e: However, it is not known which of these is currently housed within the Amitabha hall.
However, it is not known which of these is currently housed within the Amitabha hall.
However, it is not known which of these is currently housed within the Amitabha hall.

sen.j: なお、浄土真宗の開祖である親鸞は、承安 (日本)3年(1173年)に日野有範の子として、法界寺にて生まれたとされている（法界寺の近くには親鸞の生誕地にちなんで江戸時代に創建された日野誕生院がある）。
sen.e: It is said that Jodo Shinshu sect founder, Shinran was born at Hokai-ji Temple in 1173 as the son of Arinori HINO (Hino Tanjo-in Temple, constructed during the Edo-period and connected to the birthplace of Shinran, stands near Hokai-ji Temple).

It is said that Jodo Shinshu sect founder, Shinran was born at Hokai-ji Temple in 1173 as the son of Arinori HINO (Hino Tanjo-in Temple, constructed during the Edo-period and connected to the birthplace of Shinran, stands near Hokai-ji Temple).

It is said that Jodo Shinshu sect founder, Shinran was born at Hokai-ji Temple in 1173 as the son of Arinori HINO (Hino Tanjo-in Temple, constructed during the Edo-period and connected to the birthplace of Shinran, stands near Hokai-ji Temple).

tit.cmt: 伽藍はローマ字読みでの表記とし、補足を付けました。

sen.j: 薬師堂（本堂、重文）－1904年（明治37年）、奈良県斑鳩町竜田にあった伝燈寺の本堂を移築したもの。
sen.e: Bhaisajyaguru hall (main hall, Important Cultural Property): Originally the main hall of Dendo-ji Temple in Tatsuta, Ikaruga Cho, Nara Prefecture that was relocated in 1904.
Bhaisajyaguru hall (main hall, Important Cultural Property): Originally the main hall of Dendo-ji Temple in Tatsuta, Ikaruga Cho, Nara Prefecture that was relocated in 1904.
Bhaisajyaguru hall (main hall, Important Cultural Property): Originally the main hall of Dendo-ji Temple in Tatsuta, Ikaruga Cho, Nara Prefecture that was relocated in 1904.

sen.j: 室町時代、康正2年（1456年）の建築。
sen.e: It was constructed in 1456, during the Muromachi period.
It was constructed in 1456, during the Muromachi period.
It was constructed in 1456, during the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 「伝燈寺」については、斑鳩町の竜田神社付近にあったと思われるが詳しいことはわかっていない。
sen.e: Dendo-ji Temple was thought to have stood in the vicinity of Tatsuta-jinja Shrine in Ikaruga Cho but few details are known.
Dendo-ji Temple was thought to have stood in the vicinity of Tatsuta-jinja Shrine in Ikaruga Cho but few details are known.
Dendo-ji Temple was thought to have stood in the vicinity of Tatsuta-jinja Shrine in Ikaruga Cho but few details are known.

sen.j: 本尊薬師如来立像（重文）は平安時代後期の作で、この像に祈願すると女性の乳の出がよくなるとされ、「乳薬師」として信仰を集めている。
sen.e: The principal image wooden standing statue of Bhaisajyagur (Important Cultural Property) was created during the Heian period and has come to be worshipped as 'Chichi Bhaisajyagur' (healthy breast-feeding Bhaisajyagur) as it is believed that praying to the statue will improve the flow of breast milk.

The principal image wooden standing statue of Bhaisajyaguru (Important Cultural Property) was created during the latter part of the Heian period and has come to be worshipped as 'Chichi Bhaisajyaguru' (healthy breast-feeding Bhaisajyaguru) as it is believed that praying to the statue will improve the flow of breast milk.

The principal image wooden standing statue of Bhaisajyaguru (Important Cultural Property) was created during the latter part of the Heian period and has come to be worshipped as 'Chichi Bhaisajyaguru' (healthy breast-feeding Bhaisajyaguru) as it is believed that praying to the statue will improve the flow of breast milk.

sen.j: 阿弥陀堂（国宝）－鎌倉時代初期の建築。
sen.e: Amitabha hall (National Treasure): Built during the early Kamakura period.
Amitabha hall (National Treasure): Built during the early Kamakura period.
Amitabha hall (National Treasure): Built during the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 承久3年（1221年）の兵火で焼失後、まもない頃の建立と推定される。
sen.e: It is presumed to have been rebuilt soon after being destroyed by a fire resulting from a conflict in 1221.
It is presumed to have been rebuilt soon after being destroyed by a fire resulting from a conflict in 1221.
It is presumed to have been rebuilt soon after being destroyed by a fire resulting from a conflict in 1221.

sen.j: 方五間（正面、背面、両側面の柱間の数がいずれも5間）の堂の周囲に1間の裳階（もこし）をめぐらした形で、屋根は宝形造（ピラミッド形）で檜皮葺きである。
sen.e: The Ho-Goken (length between pillars at the front, back, right and left sides are all 5-ken) (ken= about 1.8m) hall is surrounded by a 1 ken deep pent roof enclosure and topped by a pyramidal cypress bark roof.

The Ho-Goken (length between pillars at the front, back, right and left sides are all 5-ken) (ken= about 1.8m) hall is surrounded by a 1 ken deep pent roof enclosure and topped by a pyramidal cypress bark roof.

The Ho-Goken (length between pillars at the front, back, right and left sides are all 5-ken) (ken= about 1.8m) hall is surrounded by a 1 ken deep pent roof enclosure and topped by a pyramidal cypress bark roof.

sen.j: 内陣の柱や長押上の小壁には創建当時の絵画が残る。
sen.e: Original paintings from the time of the temple's construction remain on the long, narrow, horizontal wall above the pillars and non-penetrating tie beams of the inner sanctum.
Original paintings from the time of the temple's construction remain on the long, narrow, horizontal wall above the pillars and non-penetrating tie beams of the inner sanctum.

sen.j: 像高2.8メートルの巨像で、仏師定朝の様式を受けた定朝様（よう）の阿弥陀像の典型的な作品。
sen.e: The statue is large at 2.8 meters tall and is a typical of the style of Buddhist sculptor Teicho.

sen.j: 壁画47面 - 内陣長押上の小壁に描かれた23面（飛天図10面、楽器・仏具図5面、阿弥陀如来像8面）と、その上部の壁に描かれた宝相華文（ほうそうげもん）24面からなる。
sen.e: 47 paintings: 23 of these adorn the long, narrow, horizontal wall above the upper non-penetrating tie beams of the inner sanctum (10 sky paintings, 5 paintings of instruments and Buddhist alter fittings, 8 paintings of Amitabha) and the other 24 are painted on the wall above this and depict Hoso Gemon)

sen.j: 板壁でなく土壁に描かれた壁画として日本における稀少な例の1つである。
sen.e: They are a rare example in Japan of images painted, not on wooden walls, but on mud walls.

sen.j: 四天柱4本－四天柱（仏壇周囲に立つ4本の柱を指す）にも、金剛界曼荼羅の諸仏や、十二天、迦陵頻伽などの絵画が残っているが、剥落・褪色が甚だしい。
sen.e: 4 shitenbashira: Paintings depicting images such as Vajradhatu mandala, Buddhist deities, the twelve celestials and Kalavinka remain on the shitenbashira (the four pillars placed around the Buddhist altar) but have undergone severe peeling and fading.
